features: Move Files Fast: Transfer music, movies, or entire seasons of TV shows in seconds at 40 Gbps.
HD Display: Connect your laptop to an external monitor to mirror or extend your screen in up to 8K@60Hz or 4K@144Hz.
Huge Range of Power: Supports a maximum 240W charge when paired up with a compatible charger. Charge virtually any USB-C device from phones and accessories to laptops.
Built to Last: Proven in lab tests to withstand up to 5,000 bends.
What You Get: Anker 515 USB-C to USB-C Cable (USB4, 3.3ft), welcome guide, our worry-free 18-month warranty, and friendly customer service.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Model Number: A8487 Anker 515 USB-C to USB-C Cable (USB4, 3.3ft) One Cable for All Your Work Devices Supports High-Speed Charging Pair up with a compatible charger to power up your device at up to 240W. Transfer Files in Seconds With a 40 Gbps data transfer rate, you won't have to waste time waiting for a file to transfer slowly. Move movies, music, and large files between devices at high speed. Increase Your Display Options Stream media and extend or mirror your screen to an external monitor in resolutions of up to 8K@60Hz or 4K@144Hz. Universal Compatibility Designed to work flawlessly with virtually any USB-C device including phones, tablets, and laptops. Compatibility Fully Compatible Devices: MacBook Pro 14″ (2021) MacBook Pro (M1, 2020) MacBook Pro 15.4″ (2019/2018/2017/2016) MacBook Pro 13.3″ (2020/2019/2018/2017/2016) MacBook Air (2020/2019/2018) Lenovo Yoga 14s Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Series HP Spectre Series iPad Pro 12.9″ (5th generation), iPad Pro 12.9″ (4th generation), iPad Pro 12.9″ (3rd generation), iPad Pro 12.9″ (2nd generation) iPad Air (4th generation), iPad mini (6th generation) Samsung Galaxy Note 10+/10/9/8 Samsung Galaxy S21/S21+/S20/S10+/S10e/S10/S9+/S9 Google Pixel 3/4/5/6 Limited Charging Speeds: MacBook Pro 16″ (2021) Note: This USB4 cable is not compatible with Thunderbolt 4. If connected to a Thunderbolt 4 device, performance specs will be downgraded to Thunderbolt 3.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Cable for Filming to an External Hard Drive
reviews.reviewText: I recently ventured into the world of mobile filmmaking with my iPhone, and the Anker 515 USB 4 Cable has proven to be an absolute game-changer for my creative endeavors. This cable boasts impressive features, including 8K HD display support, 40 Gbps data transfer speed, and a whopping 240W charging capability. Here's my experience using it for filming:High-Quality Video Output:The standout feature of the Anker 515 USB 4 Cable is its support for 8K HD display. Connecting my iPhone to an external monitor or display has never been smoother, and the clarity and detail in the video output are truly remarkable. This cable unlocks the full potential of my iPhone's camera, allowing me to capture and review footage in stunning detail.Lightning-Fast Data Transfer:For filmmakers, time is of the essence, and the 40 Gbps data transfer speed of this cable is a game-changer. Importing and exporting large video files between my iPhone and computer is now a breeze. The speed at which I can move my footage allows for a more streamlined editing process, saving valuable time and increasing overall efficiency.Reliable Charging Power:Filmmaking on the go often means draining the iPhone's battery quickly. With the Anker 515 USB 4 Cable's impressive 240W charging capacity, I can keep my iPhone powered up while filming, ensuring that I never miss a crucial moment. This has proven to be a lifesaver during extended shooting sessions or when I'm away from traditional power sources.Durable Build:Anker is known for its durable and reliable products, and the 515 USB 4 Cable is no exception. The cable feels robust and well-made, with reinforced connectors that inspire confidence in its longevity. It has endured constant plugging and unplugging without showing any signs of wear or degradation.Versatility and Compatibility:I appreciate the versatility of this cable, which seamlessly connects my iPhone to a range of devices, including external monitors, computers, and charging adapters. Its compatibility with various setups makes it an essential tool for any filmmaker using an iPhone as their primary camera.Overall Impression:In my journey into iPhone filmmaking, the Anker 515 USB 4 Cable has become an indispensable tool. Its combination of high-quality video output, lightning-fast data transfer, reliable charging power, durable build, and versatility make it a must-have accessory for any filmmaker or content creator looking to elevate their mobile production setup.Pros:8K HD display support40 Gbps data transfer speed240W charging capabilityDurable and well-madeVersatile and compatible with various devicesCons:None observed during my usageOverall Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐The Anker 515 USB 4 Cable has exceeded my expectations and has become an integral part of my mobile filmmaking kit. Highly recommended for anyone looking to enhance their iPhone filmmaking experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this cable to troubleshoot an issue I was having with one of my devices. The higher data transfer rates is what I needed it for and lo and behold the issue was resolved. Not only that, it can be used for a variety of other applications like connecting to another USB-C device to move files and so much more. The speed it can do so is pretty outstanding. I recommend this for its performance and great price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well Made and It Just Works
reviews.reviewText: This is a well made full function USB-C cable with high power (up to a claimed 240 watts!) charging capability. Testing reveals that it does contain an "e marker" chip to signal an attached device that higher power charging is possible.I've tested it with a 100 watt USB C charger and laptop computer. It worked perfectly well with both. I only wish it was offered in longer versions. (At the time I placed my order, it was not.) I don't have any USB C devices that use higher power to test the 240 watt claim. However, I have no reason to doubt it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best all around USB C cable
reviews.reviewText: Quality cable that is very durable and supports the fastest charging and data speeds. Clearly marked so no more guessing if the cable will work. Basically every other cable is inferior to this one. If it also supported TB4 it would be perfect.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great with your hub or dock
reviews.reviewText: Anker 515 USB 4 Cable is perfect for connecting peripherals to your hub or docking station. Maximum pass through and charging speeds.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Use as replacement of LG monitor USB-C cable. Good length and flexibility make connection with laptop easier and saves space on desk

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great cable.eapecially for 4k and 8k there's no lag or pixelation of images.
reviews.reviewText: Greatest cable ever!! Buy now before it gets too expensive. Other companies plan to realize usb cables at much higher cost! Buy!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1 cable connecting my laptop to my screen
reviews.reviewText: Works as it should. I have a monitor with PD, USB hub and ethernet RJ45 connection. All wires connect to the monitor and when I want to connect my laptop all I do is plug in this cable to one of the USB C sockets on the laptop.Just to recap - through this cable the monitor sends 95W of power to the laptop, the wired network and usb plugs and the laptop sends 4K HDR images.
Das bisher beste Kabel seiner Art, alle Verwendungen funktionieren einwandfrei, laden, 8K Video, Datendurchsatz!

lo uso para conectar un monitor DELL con mi Macbook-Pro. El monitor tiene un hub integrado con Ethernet.Con el cable anterior el test de velocidad no superaba los 100 Mb, con este llega a los 900 Mb.Muy contento con el cable, conecta sin problemas, tiene un buen acabado y es lo suficientemente flexible, no es demasiado rigido. Es caro pero no me arrepiento de la compra.
